product_context.title: Opportunity Assessment: Employee profile improvements
product_context.why_built: 33 companies currently have manual restrictions on employee profile editing (17 for documents, 9 for personal/work info, 7 for dependent info). Larger organizations struggle with data integrity when employees can freely edit sensitive information. The feature addresses three key needs: (1) Admin control over profile photos when employees don't add them, (2) Granular permission controls to restrict employee editing of documents, personal/work info, and dependent data, (3) Customizable employee directory fields to show relevant information like country of residence and manager for remote team collaboration. Aha votes: 44 for edit permissions, 40 for delete restriction.
key_design_decisions: Permission controls are organization-wide, not per-employee, to simplify administration
Approval workflows are reusable for both document changes and payment details changes
Email notifications are mandatory when approval workflows are enabled to ensure transparency
Support for both English and Arabic languages to serve diverse user base
Admin photo upload capability on both web and mobile platforms for consistency
Directory customization allows selective field display (Country of Residence, Manager) for relevant information sharing
Granular permission configuration for documents, personal info, work info, and dependent data
Approval workflow system for document and payment detail changes
Directory field customization with Country of Residence and Manager as key fields
Email notifications for all approval requests
Arabic language support for all permission settings
Change request history tracking for audit compliance

product_context.title: PRD: Employee Records V2.1
product_context.why_built: Current employee list management limits display to 10 employees at a time, creating friction for companies with large workforces. The feature improves employee list management by allowing admins to view up to 500 employees at once, use global search accessible via CMD/CTRL+K from anywhere in the product, see recently viewed employees and recent searches for quick access, and view additional employee data points (role, department) directly in the list without navigating to individual profiles.
key_design_decisions: Configurable rows per page (10/25/50/100/250/500) allows admins to control display density based on their needs
Global search accessible via CMD/CTRL+K from anywhere in the product for quick access
Recently viewed employees (up to 5) and recent searches (up to 5) are displayed before typing to enable quick navigation
Employee list displays name, role, and department columns for at-a-glance information
Edit icon removed from employee table rows to reduce clutter; editing requires navigating to full profile
UAE-specific fields (Residence Visa Location, Trade License, MOL No.) are conditionally displayed based on Legal Country of Residence
DOB date picker disables future dates to prevent invalid entries
Recently viewed employees (up to 5) shown before search query
Recent search terms (up to 5) shown for quick re-access
Circle with initials retained for employee avatars
UAE-specific fields conditional display based on Legal Country of Residence
Analytics tracking for search behavior and keyboard shortcut usage

detected_integrations.description: Office location configuration and employee office assignment enable location-based attendance check-ins. Employees can check in from their assigned office location within a configurable radius.
Employee office location assignment enables mobile check-in functionality. Profile photo upload and directory customization are implemented on both web and mobile platforms.
Company bank account configuration is linked to payroll processing, enabling salary payments to be directed to the correct account associated with the appropriate Trade License.

Document type configuration enables tracking of required documents, automatic expiry reminders, and document approval workflows. Document permissions control whether employees can add, edit, or delete documents.
Document expiry reminders are sent via email based on configured frequency. Approval request notifications are sent when document or payment detail changes require admin approval.
Reusable approval workflows for document changes and payment details changes. When employee editing is restricted, change requests trigger approval workflows requiring admin authorization.
Customizable employee directory displays selected fields including Country of Residence and Manager. Directory customization applies to both web portal and mobile app People section.
Global search (CMD/CTRL+K) accessible from anywhere in the product enables quick employee lookup. Recently viewed employees and recent searches are tracked for quick navigation.
Bank account configuration requires selection of associated Trade License. Office location assignment may be linked to Trade License for multi-location companies.
UAE-specific fields (Residence Visa Location, Trade License, MOL No.) are conditionally displayed in employee records based on Legal Country of Residence.
Employee invitations trigger registration flow; invitation expiration and resend logic integrated with auth system
Critical business processes (gratuity calculations) depend on complete employee profile data. Missing validation rules indicate incomplete data integrity checks across modules.
Tracks search bar clicks, keyboard shortcut usage, and failed searches for product insights
Chat feature for email change requests when employee has already registered and admin cannot modify directly

Employee Profile integrates with Leave Management for leave record visibility and balance adjustments. Issues include leave records disappearing after policy unassignment and inability to manually adjust balances.
Employee Profile work tab makes unnecessary API calls to time-off configuration endpoint, triggering 403 errors for users without time-off permissions.
Employee Profile connects to payroll for IBAN management and financial reporting. Lacks automated IBAN lookup tool and unified name field for reporting.
Goal tracking and 360-degree reviews require integration with employee profile and status management. Current gaps in supporting unregistered employees indicate incomplete integration.
Employee Profile deletion is blocked by entity relationships with soft-deletable related entities. User deletion cannot cascade properly across interconnected records.
Employee Profile has incomplete translation coverage during company onboarding and inconsistent language-specific field naming.

Leave and attendance workflows are tightly coupled. Issues with partial day leave, check-in reconciliation, and absence status determination indicate integration gaps between leave management and attendance tracking.

Leave requests impact payroll calculations. Current system lacks real-time payroll impact visualization during leave request submission, indicating incomplete data flow between leave and payroll modules.
Shift scheduling impacts employee attendance and leave management. Lack of bulk shift operations and automated cleanup of scheduling impacts suggests incomplete integration with attendance workflows.
Mobile app crashes and UI inconsistencies suggest underlying framework or navigation handling issues affecting multiple modules including employee records and calendar features.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Profile Form Save & Input Validation Failures
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The Employee Profile form lacks robust input validation and data persistence mechanisms. Users experience save failures on the Work tab, avatar upload processing delays, and inability to save nationality field data. The system allows incomplete or invalid data entry without clear validation feedback.

The Employee Profile location fields have incomplete geographic data. The city dropdown for Saudi Arabia lacks several important regional cities, and work location dropdowns are restricted to the company's registered country only, preventing multi-country GCC employee management.

The Employee Profile lacks consistent integration with leave management. Leave records disappear after policy unassignment, hire date validation blocks page access instead of allowing deferred validation, and the system cannot manually adjust leave balances or support negative balance scenarios required for complex leave administration.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Employee Profile Deletion & Data Recovery Limitations
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The Employee Profile deletion and recovery system has critical gaps. Deleted profiles without associated user IDs cannot be recovered, partial data recovery creates uncertainty about what data is lost, and the user deletion mechanism cannot handle entity relationships, preventing complete removal when soft-deletable related entities exist.

The Employee Profile reporting and visibility features lack comprehensive data access. Names are always split into separate columns preventing unified 'Full Name' reporting, profile completion filtering restricts visibility to incomplete profiles only, and there is no automated IBAN lookup tool to identify which employee owns a specific bank account.

The Employee Profile interface has inconsistent navigation patterns and missing functionality. Delete action placement does not match user expectations, policy view lacks a dialog mechanism to display policy details, employee name links work selectively (in comments but not in transaction submission), and responsive design constraints prevent proper table rendering across device sizes.
what_to_watch_out_for.design_rationale: Some navigation decisions were intentionally deferred (delete placement, policy view dialog) as part of v2 redesign planning.

what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The Employee Profile has incomplete localization support. Certain language translations do not automatically populate during company onboarding, Arabic translation for job title field is inconsistent, and translation rendering issues exist in the older Ember frontend framework.

The Employee Profile work information update triggers an unnecessary API call to the time-off configuration endpoint, which returns a 403 error for users without time-off management permissions. This indicates overly broad authorization checks that block legitimate profile updates.

The Employee Profile system lacks automated email reminder functionality for incomplete profiles. HR administrators must manually track and follow up on profile completion, creating additional administrative overhead and reducing visibility into profile completion status.

The Employee Profile lacks comprehensive backend mechanisms for handling nationality changes for KSA employees, including document management and warning message generation. Additionally, service year calculations for milestone posts appear inaccurate, suggesting date parsing or calculation logic issues.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Partial Day Leave & Flexible Check-in Restrictions
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: Employees who take half-day leave cannot flexibly check in for the remaining work hours. The system does not support partial day work hour reconciliation, forcing employees into rigid all-or-nothing leave patterns.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Leave Balance Visibility During Request Submission
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: Employees and managers cannot view current leave balance at the point of leave request submission. The system lacks real-time balance display, forcing users to check balance separately before submitting requests.

Employees and administrators cannot see real-time financial impact of leave requests during the request creation process. The system lacks payroll impact visualization, preventing informed decision-making about leave timing.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Missing Mandatory Field Validation in Critical Workflows
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The system allows submission of critical business processes (e.g., gratuity calculations) without validating mandatory employee profile fields like hiredAt date. This creates data integrity risks and potential calculation errors.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Restricted Bulk Role Management & Audit Logging
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The platform lacks comprehensive audit logging for employee record updates and does not support role management through Excel bulk imports. HR administrators cannot efficiently track changes or manage complex multi-role structures at scale.

The Shift Scheduler lacks bulk shift copying capabilities and does not automatically clean up future scheduled impacts when employees are unassigned from offices. Schedulers must manually create individual shift assignments, creating time-consuming workflows.

The mobile application crashes when navigating between employee search results and individual profiles. Users experience app instability when interacting with employee records, limiting mobile usability.

The Employee Records interface lacks design consistency with other modules (e.g., Employee Documents). Navigation elements produce unexpected feedback, and data rendering is incomplete (e.g., 'Wish Me On' section remains empty despite backend data availability).

The platform lacks automated milestone tracking for birthdays and work anniversaries, and the mobile app does not support calendar sharing. These gaps limit employee engagement and team collaboration capabilities.

The performance management module lacks 360-degree review capabilities and does not support goal confirmation for unregistered or inactive employees. This prevents comprehensive performance evaluations and complete goal tracking for all employee statuses.

what_to_watch_out_for.theme: Leave Request UX & Missing Historical Context
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The leave request interface lacks historical context display, preventing employees from referencing past leave selections. Additionally, time-off setup produces intermittent errors, and administrators cannot view pro-rated days fields in edit dialogs.
